channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-705] hbase shell list command does not handle RegionOfflineException
item.description:
I get a RegionOfflineException error when trying to use the list command with a region offline

hbase(main):005:0* list
08/06/25 02:43:30 DEBUG client.HConnectionManager$TableServers: Cache hit in table locations for row <> and tableName .META.: location server 64.69.33.211:60020, location region name .META.,,1
08/06/25 02:43:30 DEBUG client.HConnectionManager$TableServers: reloading table servers because: region offline: webdata,,1214377950920
08/06/25 02:43:30 DEBUG client.HConnectionManager$TableServers: Removed .META.,,1 from cache because of webdata,,99999999999999
08/06/25 02:43:30 DEBUG client.HConnectionManager$TableServers: Found ROOT REGION => {NAME => '-ROOT-,,0', STARTKEY => '', ENDKEY => '', ENCODED => 70236052, TABLE => {NAME => '-ROOT-', FAMILIES => [{NAME => 'info', VERSIONS => 1, COMPRESSION => 'NONE', IN_MEMORY => false, BLOCKCACHE => false, LENGTH => 2147483647, TTL => FOREVER, BLOOMFILTER => NONE}]}

08/06/25 02:43:40 DEBUG client.HConnectionManager$TableServers: Removed .META.,,1 from cache because of webdata,,99999999999999

item.summary: hbase shell list command does not handle RegionOfflineException

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I have not notice before but with the new shell when I get the above error the gui on the master port 60010 goes down and returns a HTTP ERROR: 500 error

Whats wrong with the above Billy? You get an ugly but informative message about whats up with your table. Would you prefer that the stack trace not be dumped into the shell? Previously, the shell used to catch exception and then try to parse the exception to output a 'nice' message. Sometimes this worked. Other times, the parse would hide errors (HBASE-652). Also, the shell didn't exit, right, as it used to.

Regards the 500 error code, can I see master log? I cannot see how a client action could bring down a master, but you never know.
Looks good now I see it only shows up in debug that cool.
